tweet_text: Over 500,000 vaccines have been given to Native American communities to combat the effects of COVID-19, with more to come. The Indian Health Service has played a vital role in administering these doses, alongside strong partnerships with Tribal governments, organizations, and urban Indian groups. Despite challenges, progress is being made.

CVS Pharmacy in Massachusetts is administering COVID-19 vaccines to K-12 teachers, daycare and preschool workers, and staff. This news comes as a relief to many who have been eagerly waiting for the vaccine to become more widely available.

Over 13.5 million people have received their first dose of a COVID-19 vaccine as of January 19th, with over 2 million having received both doses and are fully vaccinated. The vaccines are crucial for stopping the pandemic. More information can be found at the provided link.
According to Pfizer, their COVID-19 vaccine is 97% effective against symptomatic COVID and 94% effective against asymptomatic disease. This is a remarkable achievement in the field of science.

COVID-19 vaccines authorized in the EU have undergone rigorous testing and trials to ensure their safety and effectiveness. Europeans can trust the authorized vaccines in the market as they have been approved based on proven clinical data. #SafeVaccines.

Arizona's underserved communities face obstacles like limited internet access and transportation, which hinder their ability to receive COVID-19 vaccines. To address this issue, programs are being implemented to increase accessibility and ensure more vaccines are distributed.

According to an article from Health Impact News, the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine has been linked to higher death rates in young people than the virus itself. Elderly people also experienced more deaths after receiving the vaccine as compared to those who did not. The article suggests that further research is needed to fully understand these claims.
President Biden has made it a priority to provide COVID-19 vaccines this month to teachers, school staff, and child care workers, as part of the effort to help the country get back on track.

The US government's efficient logistics and procurement efforts have led to a surplus of Covid vaccines, thanks to their use of "Transwarp Drive". This success was achieved through a disciplined approach and mastery of logistics, referred to as "Warp Speed". All that is left is for people to continue following safety measures until enough individuals are vaccinated.
The EU has approved the fourth COVID-19 vaccine, Janssen (Johnson & Johnson), ensuring it's safe and effective. The vaccine is now available on the EU market.

The safety and efficacy of proposed COVID-19 vaccines have not been scientifically established, contrary to reports from mainstream media outlets such as the BBC. Reliable sources can be found on the author's blog.

The Indian government's vaccine exports are not an act of charity but rather part of an equitable distribution plan funded by a $150 million grant from the Gates Foundation. The grant was given to the Serum Institute to ensure that low- and middle-income nations have access to the COVID-19 vaccine.

New variants of SARS-CoV-2, namely the California (B.1.427/B.1.429) and New York (B.1.526) strains, have been identified alongside the B.1.1.7, B.1.351, P.1 and B.1.2 lineages. The emergence of these variants highlights the potential impact of viral evolution on the efficacy of COVID-19 vaccines. More information can be found in the updated article at the given link.
In Hardin and Orange counties in Texas, COVID-19 vaccines are now available to anyone, not just those in phase 1A and 1B.
China will donate coronavirus vaccines to 53 countries and sell them to 27 others, with state media highlighting the deliveries.

Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear reported on Wednesday that the state's positivity rate has continued to decline to 3.93%. He attributed this improvement to the growing number of people who have received one of three highly effective COVID-19 vaccines, as well as the public's compliance with public health guidelines.

Over 1.8 million COVID-19 vaccines have been given in Maryland, with an average of 42,705 shots per day. Those in Phase 1 can pre-register for vaccinations at the state's mass vaccination sites through the website or phone number provided.

Khairy, the Malaysian Minister in charge of the Covid-19 vaccination programme, has welcomed the private sector's efforts to procure approved Covid-19 vaccines. Malaysia is aiming to achieve herd immunity by February 2022, administering 160,000 doses of the vaccine daily during the second and third phases of the programme.

Michigan will receive 11,400 doses of Johnson & Johnson COVID-19 vaccine along with 98,200 first dose Pfizer vaccines and 133,380 first dose Moderna vaccines next week. The total number of vaccines that Michigan will have including J&J, first and second doses will be 474,560.

During his appearance on Fox News, country musician Larry Gatlin claimed that he contracted COVID-19 four days after receiving his second dose of the Moderna vaccine. Gatlin then sarcastically thanked Moderna for giving him the virus. The Fox host corrected him, stating that vaccines do not contain the live virus.

The COVID-19 vaccines are safe and effective as they undergo strict clinical trials before being authorized by the FDA. They are also continuously monitored for their effectiveness. To learn more, visit the provided link.

People with End-Stage Renal Disease (ESRD) have a high risk of death due to COVID-19. Therefore, it is important that both dialysis patients and clinical staff receive quick and prioritized access to the COVID-19 vaccine in the dialysis clinic.
The JNJ vaccine, similar to Pfizer and Moderna, is safe and protects against COVID-19-related hospitalization and death. Find out more at the provided link.

The Philippines will receive 1.4 million more doses of the CoronaVac vaccine this month, according to Carlito Galvez Jr., the country's vaccine chief. This is in addition to the vaccines already delivered to the country as part of its ongoing vaccination programme against COVID-19.
The Philippines has received COVID-19 vaccines donated by China, marking a new phase in the country's fight against the virus, which has infected over 576,352 people and caused over 12,318 deaths.

Russia is using the promotion of its Sputnik V vaccine as a tool to spread disinformation and discredit Western vaccines. This is part of a larger disinformation campaign that has weaponized the COVID-19 pandemic. Read more about the how and why in this article.

Initially, pregnant women were not part of the clinical trials for the Pfizer-BioNTech and Moderna Covid-19 vaccines. However, a growing body of evidence suggests that the vaccines are safe for pregnant women.

Toronto and Peel Region are moving into the grey zone, while Toronto is getting closer to reaching the milestone of administering 200,000 COVID-19 vaccines in the city. Listen to the latest news on 680 NEWS TO GO with @TheAsherRoth & @ZackBodenstein.

Sudan reported its first COVID-19 case on March 13, 2020. Within a year, approved vaccines have arrived in Khartoum, showcasing the power of science and solidarity. Although there is still more work to be done to ensure equal access, this progress is impressive.

The author of the tweet, directed at US President Joe Biden, is urging for an investigation into the actions of a governor who has allegedly been providing vaccines to wealthy areas and receiving large campaign donations around the same time. The tweet includes a link to an article detailing the latest incident.

Pittsburgh Public Schools' teachers and staff have received COVID-19 vaccines in preparation for students returning to classrooms. This aligns with the millions of Americans who have at least one dose of the vaccine.

A new COVID vaccine from Zydus Cadilla, an Indian pharmaceutical company, will be available this year. The DNA vaccine uses a new technology and has great potential. For more information, check out the chat with @kushmaan95 on @aajtakradio.
California COVID-19 website now lists 2,315 locations for COVID-19 vaccines, and they have more places to add.

The Jamaican government has set aside $60 billion to purchase COVID-19 vaccines and support social and economic recovery through the SERVE Jamaica Programme. This initiative was announced by the Holness administration on Tuesday.

Over 6,000 COVID-19 vaccinations, including first and second doses, were administered by healthcare workers in Williamson County during a 24-hour "vax-a-thon" held at the Kelly Reeves Athletic Complex last weekend.
Russia is spreading disinformation about two vaccines used in the US to undermine confidence in the COVID-19 vaccine rollout and sow division. The Kremlin aims to spread anti-vaxxer disinformation.

In Iowa, individuals under the age of 65 with a BMI index of 30-40+ are now eligible to receive COVID vaccines. This is because the CDC considers obesity as an underlying condition that increases the risk of COVID. Although BMI scores are not always accurate, if this makes someone eligible, they should go ahead and get vaccinated.

Pediatricians and advocates are urging President Biden to prioritize COVID-19 vaccinations for children as the country works towards reopening and more adults receive vaccinations. They want to make sure that children are not left behind in the vaccination process.
Oregon has administered 1,142,035 initial and booster doses of COVID-19 vaccines.

Students, alumni and faculty members worked together to administer hundreds of Covid-19 vaccines during Towncrest Pharmacy clinics held over the weekend. The students' contribution plays an important role in the ongoing rollout of the coronavirus vaccine.

The Johnson & Johnson Janssen vaccine has been authorized for use in Alaska alongside the other two authorized vaccines. All three vaccines are safe and effective across different ages, races and ethnicities. You can read the press release about this news on this link:  https://t.co/dCERadG4kS.

Over 25,000 people suffering from chronic illnesses, cancer, autoimmune diseases, and rare diseases have participated in a longitudinal study on the COVID-19 vaccine. The study covers topics such as vaccine hesitancy, vaccine side effects, and long-term COVID. An interactive dashboard of the study's findings is available online.

I received my first Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine and am grateful for it. Congratulations to everyone involved in developing and administering this vaccine. #AstraZeneca #vaccines #vaccine #vaccinated #oxfordastrazeneca #COVID19
Novavax's COVID-19 vaccine trials have shown protection against the variants in the UK and South Africa.

Unvaccinated people are 44 times more likely to develop symptoms of COVID-19 and 29 times more likely to die from the virus than those who have been vaccinated, according to a recent analysis. This highlights the effectiveness of vaccines.

It's important to get vaccinated against COVID-19 to avoid long-term effects like headaches, loss of smell and taste, and shortness of breath. If you choose not to get vaccinated, that's okay, but those who do are making a smart choice.

Beginning Thursday, those aged 50 and older in Summit County will be eligible to receive the COVID-19 vaccine. The location to obtain the vaccine can be found in the latest update from the local news source, with mass clinics also becoming available soon.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander adults will receive the COVID-19 vaccine soon after the first priority group, including health and border workers. This is done to ensure the safety of communities and families. More details are available at the given link.
Corbett, a viral immunologist, and her team helped develop one of the first two successful COVID vaccines. They played an important role in advancing science to save lives.
Currently, there are 1,125,600 doses of COVID-19 vaccines available in the country from Sinovac (China) and AstraZeneca (COVAX Facility).

Utah has reported 412 new cases of COVID-19 and one new death, bringing the total number of cases to 374,850 and deaths to 1,976. The state has also administered 855,663 vaccines since the start of the outbreak, and conducted 3,912,298 total tests.

If we can't obtain them on time, we should promptly order additional Pfizer vaccines. Our scheduled Novavax and J&J vaccines may have only 55% and 57% effectiveness against the SA strain, respectively.
Lipid shells are necessary for mRNA vaccines for COVID-19 to work. Lipoprotein(a) is linked to higher risk of large artery atherosclerosis stroke and stroke recurrence in patients under 60 years old.
India has given 40,000 COVID-19 vaccines to Antigua and Barbuda, and 80,000 vaccines to Guyana through its 'Vaccine Maitri' scheme.

A shipment of 3,000 COVID-19 vaccines donated by the United Arab Emirates was transported from Brazil to Paraguay via a coordinated effort between the Paraguayan Air Force, Ministry of Public Health, and an airline. The successful delivery brings hope amid the ongoing pandemic.

Over the weekend, Congresswoman Jan Schakowsky, Congressman Brad Schneider, Cook County Board President Toni Preckwinkle, and Commissioner Dennis Deer Britton visited the Des Plaines COVID-19 vaccination site and spoke to the people receiving the vaccine. The site successfully administered vaccines to over 2,500 individuals on Saturday.

Dr. Camile McDonald-Toussaint and the author distributed Covid-19 vaccines in North Lauderdale for over 250 residents. They emphasized the importance of vaccination as a way to end the pandemic and gain freedom from the virus.

Georgia has received its first batch of COVID-19 vaccines through the Covax facility. The European Union is supporting Covax and is proud to stand with Georgia during the pandemic. Georgian health professionals will soon receive protection from COVID-19.
Great apes at San Diego Zoo have received coronavirus vaccinations following an outbreak of the virus, believed to have been transmitted by a human handler.

The first COVID-19 vaccines are being administered in Uganda as part of the COVAX initiative. The European Union is proud to support this initiative and reminds people to continue practicing measures such as social distancing and wearing masks.
The COVID-19 vaccines do not contain fetal tissue, implants, microchips, or tracking devices. A Q&A pamphlet is available for older Canadians to answer their questions about the vaccine.

Getting vaccinated is the best defense against Covid-19. The vaccines are safe and effective. For more details, visit the given website. LAS medic Rasak has received the vaccine and urges everyone to get vaccinated. Watch his message at the provided link. #TeamLAS

The president of the Philippines, Duterte, announced that Davao City can expect to receive more COVID-19 vaccines from both the national government and private companies in the upcoming days. The details can be found in the provided link.
Maryland has vaccinated 926 out of 1,040 vulnerable inmates, and 570 have received a full vaccine dose, according to the state's Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services.

More than 100 frontline workers in Fiji are being trained by the Ministry of Health this week for the roll-out of COVID-19 vaccines. The training, supported by UNICEF and WHO, aims to equip these workers with the necessary knowledge, training, and support for the vaccines.

The health minister of Saudi Arabia has reassured the public about the safety of COVID-19 vaccines being distributed in the kingdom. This comes after reports caused concerns globally about potential side-effects and health risks of some vaccines.

The World Bank has pledged $500M to support the Philippines in ensuring affordable and fair access to COVID-19 vaccines. This will aid the country's efforts towards #ResilientRecovery and the strengthening of healthcare systems, ultimately saving lives.
In 2005, ferrets were given SARS-CoV-1 mRNA vaccines in the same way as the COVID-19 mRNA vaccines. There were no harmful effects and the ferrets remained healthy.
Multiple COVID-19 vaccines are available that are safe and effective. To learn more about their safety, click on the provided link.

Private, nonprofit health centers have been successful in administering vaccines to minority groups. Almost two-thirds of the 15,863 vaccines given as of Feb. 28 went to African Americans, Hispanics, and Asians.

The first Quad vaccine initiative involves India manufacturing Johnson and Johnson's single dose COVID shot, with funding from the US and Japan. Australia will then be responsible for shipping the vaccines to Southeast Asia and the Pacific countries. This was announced during the Quad Summit and has been dubbed the Pharmacy of the World initiative.

Azerbaijan has started vaccinating its population against COVID-19 and aims to vaccinate at least 20% of the population this year. More than 400,000 citizens have already received the vaccine, making Azerbaijan the first South Caucasus country to do so.
Rwanda's President Paul Kagame and First Lady Jeannette Kagame have received their COVID-19 vaccines at King Faisal Hospital in Rwanda.

Pfizer is asking for unusual collateral, including bank reserves, embassy buildings, and military bases, in exchange for COVID-19 vaccines. The pharmaceutical company is demanding ransom from sovereign governments.
President Rodrigo Duterte and other Cabinet members greeted the arrival of 600,000 Sinovac COVID-19 vaccines from China to the Philippines. Photos of the event are available online.
The COVID Focus Report highlights the potential of intranasal vaccines for COVID-19. Four intranasal vaccine candidates from China, India, the U.K., and the U.S. are in Phase 1 trials as of March 10.
A new report suggests that the SARS-CoV-2 virus, responsible for the Covid-19 pandemic, is mutating to evade antibody binding, rendering existing vaccines ineffective in under a year.

Misinformation about COVID-19 vaccines causing infertility has been circulating since December, causing concern among the public. However, there has been a collective response from professional and news organizations denouncing these false claims.
A production facility in Bloomington, Indiana will provide additional COVID-19 vaccine doses for Americans, according to a report by @IIB.

Even though the COVID-19 vaccines are available, it is still important to take personal safety measures such as wearing a mask, avoiding crowds, and maintaining a distance of at least six feet. It is also advisable not to socialize with people who do not live with us. While the vaccine can provide additional protection, one's individual actions play a significant role in slowing the spread of the virus.
Since December, the mRNA COVID-19 vaccines have generated more side effect reports to VAERS than all other vaccines combined, with eight times the number of death reports.

Vietnam has marked six months without any coronavirus deaths, while Cuba is on the brink of producing two vaccines against Covid-19 and dispatched health experts to 40 countries during the pandemic. Philosopher Georg Lukács argued that even the worst socialism is better than the best capitalism.
Russia is running a misinformation operation to erode trust in the Pfizer COVID vaccine, which poses a significant threat to our national health security and hinders efforts to tackle the pandemic.
Clinical trial data has shown that the Johnson & Johnson vaccine is 100% effective in preventing hospitalizations and deaths caused by Covid-19.
It's important to know the facts about COVID-19 vaccines. Talk to your doctor and consider getting vaccinated. Vaccines are effective and can save lives.

The Director-General of the World Health Organization (WHO) has expressed concerns that some wealthy nations are making separate deals directly with COVID-19 vaccine manufacturers, reducing the number of doses available through the WHO's COVAX initiative.

People who spread misinformation about COVID-19 are now promoting false vaccine fears despite evidence that vaccines are safe. These same individuals previously claimed that COVID-19 was like the flu, that masks were ineffective, that herd immunity had been achieved and that BCG and HCQ with Zinc was a reliable treatment. However, the data did not support these claims then, and it still does not support them now.
Monoclonal antibody treatments could reduce COVID-19 symptoms in specific patients and keep them from being hospitalized, even though vaccines are intended to prevent the disease.
The Florida Governor is accused of selling COVID-19 vaccines to Republican donors and privileged individuals. Critics have called for him to be removed from office.
Encourage your loved ones to get vaccinated against COVID-19. The vaccines are safe, effective, and have undergone thorough testing. Don't hesitate, vaccinate!
The COVID-19 mRNA Vaccine BNT162b2 has not been studied for interactions with other medicines or vaccines. It is not known if the vaccine can be given at the same time as other vaccines.

Australia has started administering COVID-19 vaccines to its first priority groups. For information on the vaccination program rollout and where to get the vaccine, visit https://t.co/g4IbPPSzQn. #COVID19 #coronavirus #COVID19vaccines pic.twitter.com/oXm6oC8aAE.

According to Gita Gopinath from the International Monetary Fund (IMF), India has played a significant role in fighting the COVID-19 pandemic by manufacturing and exporting vaccines to many countries. She praised India's vaccine policy and stated that the country is a standout in this area.
Gurdeep Singh Sappal, a former CEO of Rajya Sabha TV and known supporter of the Congress party, criticized the low cost of COVID-19 vaccines being offered at private vaccination centers.

The EU, UK, US, and other countries are preventing the expansion of vaccine production at the World Trade Organization, which is prolonging the pandemic. More information can be found on the WTO website and a detailed Q&A is available on the Human Rights Watch website.
Although dozens of deaths have been reported among people who received COVID-19 vaccines in Ohio, authorities have found no evidence that the vaccine caused these deaths.

The National Review of Immunology has published an article discussing how COVID-19 vaccines activate innate immunity to produce long-lasting immunological memory. The article also explores the potential impact of using these vaccines to protect populations in the future.

Despite the European Commission President's promise that COVID-19 vaccines would be considered a "universal, common good," the EU has since fiercely defended patents on these vaccines and medicines. This article highlights the EU's global role in patents and the controversial TRIPS waiver.

Vimeo has removed a video accompanying an article about vaccine safety from its site, stating that information questioning the safety of vaccines is not allowed. The article's author has chosen to upload the video to their own website instead.

Republicans and the media are attempting to attribute the success of the coronavirus vaccine to Trump and his Operation Warp Speed initiative. However, the vaccines were already being developed several months prior to this program. Source: @politicususa.

Tun Dr Siti Hasmah clarified that she received a COVID-19 vaccine as a senior citizen and not as Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad's wife. She got vaccinated in Langkawi to encourage locals to do the same, as there are still doubts surrounding the vaccines.

Researchers at MacGlobalNexus are working to develop vaccines and improve personal protective equipment (PPE) to combat COVID-19. In addition, they are sharing their knowledge to help shape effective policies that protect the health of Canadians.

The head of the World Trade Organization, Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala, is calling on the European Union and other members to stop export restrictions on Covid-19 vaccines and other necessary medical products in the fight against the pandemic.

Transparency should be central to the public discussion of vaccines and treatments for the pandemic, which affects every person on Earth. This is the most relevant discussion of 2021. Join the call for #VaccinesTransparency.
JDRF is urging the CDC to prioritize COVID-19 vaccines for individuals with type 1 diabetes and has provided a toolkit for advocacy efforts at the local level.
Alban Bagbin, the Speaker of Parliament, has led members and staff to receive the first shot of COVID-19 vaccines. The event was captured by TV3GH.

According to @TheAmirImani, taking the first COVID-19 vaccine offered is crucial in overcoming the pandemic. Shopping around for different vaccines could negate the effectiveness of vaccination efforts. It is best to take the vaccine as soon as possible and allow time for everything to settle before determining next steps.

All COVID-19 vaccines approved in Canada, including AstraZeneca, have been found to prevent severe disease, hospitalization and death, according to research studies. This statement was made by Dr. Daniel Warshovsky from the Ontario College and University of Toronto's Family Medicine Community of Practice.
Third Baptist Church is providing COVID-19 vaccines on March 14, 2021, from 12 PM to 4 PM. The vaccines are available to everyone, regardless of age or insurance status.

Florida has fallen to 42nd place in the country for vaccine administration due to a lacking plan, arrogance, politicization, and pay-to-play tactics. The state ranks below New York, Texas, and California. Some are calling for Governor Ron DeSantis to be removed from office.

Texas officials claim that the federal government is using outdated population data to determine COVID-19 vaccine allocation, potentially causing the state to lose millions of doses. Governor Abbott and health officials are pushing for an update to the data to ensure fair distribution of vaccines.
AMC is hopeful that COVID-19 vaccines and upcoming movies will improve sales this year.

The New York Times has recognized the variances in response to Covid-19 and vaccines between men and women, which is uncommon for the paper to adhere to a binary model of sex. They don't mention that men have a higher mortality rate from the virus, however.

Iloilo City Mayor Jerry Treñas has urged the Department of Health Region 6 to expedite the distribution of COVID-19 vaccines. The mayor conveyed this message to the testing czar and NTF Against on the previous day.

New York City is expanding the availability of free COVID-19 vaccines to people aged 60 or above. More locations have been added to administer the vaccines. Interested individuals can book an appointment at https://t.co/9MtvogiXpz.
The article argues that agreeing with the government's stance on requiring vaccines and vaccine certificates for a virus that has a survival rate of over 99.7% could lead to medical tyranny.

To prevent the emergence of even more dangerous COVID-19 variants and prolonging the pandemic, it is crucial to increase global access to vaccines, warn experts in Foreign Affairs. Without such action, there is a risk that "variants of concern" will develop, giving the virus the chance to spread further and resist existing vaccines.

Medecins Sans Frontieres has said that if intellectual property rights for vaccines are temporarily removed and companies share their knowledge, mRNA vaccine production could begin within a few months. They said that the proposed TRIPS waiver could allow for increased vaccine production.
Starting next Monday, teachers, childcare providers, and staff in Indiana will be eligible to receive COVID-19 vaccines.

A group of 86 Catholic women have written a letter opposing the use of COVID-19 vaccines that they claim are tainted by abortion. They argue that the approval given by the Church for these vaccines is based on an incomplete understanding of the science behind vaccination and immunology.

Medical charity, Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF), has called on Australia to stop blocking a proposal at the World Trade Organisation (WTO) aimed at improving access to Covid-19 treatments and vaccines. MSF warns that by refusing to support the proposal, Australia is helping to stall the distribution of vaccines and treatments to developing countries.

The tweet questions why Ireland is choosing to prioritize its loyalty to the EU over the health of its citizens by not purchasing the Russian coronavirus vaccine, while Slovakia has decided to buy it. It includes a link to an article reporting on Slovakia's decision to purchase the vaccine, following in the footsteps of Hungary.

Equitable distribution of vaccines is crucial for our COVID-19 recovery. We need to work together to build a sustainable future for people and the planet, starting with the United Nations. #OnlyTogether.

The writer sends well wishes to ODM party leader Raila Odinga for a speedy recovery from COVID-19. They emphasize the importance of prevention and express hopes that the vaccines acquired by the country will help manage the virus effectively.

The European Union (EU) has not developed any vaccines on its own. Private companies within the EU have developed the vaccines and sold them through commercial deals. Talking about taking control of vaccines is an attack on the private enterprise that has provided us with a solution to Covid. The article criticizes the use of confusing jargon related to this topic.

Using a single vaccine for COVID-19, instead of multiple vaccines with different protocols, will make the rollout easier in New Zealand. This means that every person can receive the same vaccine and be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

Rwanda received and distributed both Pfizer and Astrazeneca vaccines throughout the country, making it a historic week. The conversation about post-COVID-19 world for children and other topics will be discussed by representative LindseyJulianna on @1035KISSFM at 2 PM today.

Agostini's acquisition means they will now represent three of the international companies that have approved Covid-19 vaccines on the market: AstraZeneca, Pfizer and Johnson & Johnson. Further details can be found at the provided link.

Despite the availability of COVID-19 vaccines in Georgia, many people are still waiting to become eligible. However, there are still easy steps we can take to save lives, such as wearing masks, practicing physical distancing, and frequently washing our hands to protect ourselves and our community.

Peru's Health Minister has acknowledged the quality of medicines and vaccines produced by Cuba and has confirmed talks with the country may take place for the purchase of their COVID-19 vaccine, Soberana 02.

The article provides a list of 13 COVID-19 vaccines being used globally along with the countries that use them. The list mentions that 9 of these vaccines have not yet been approved by major Western drug regulators due to the lack of published clinical trial data.
Former UK Prime Minister Tony Blair's think tank has advised that the country should store vaccines and antivirals in preparation for a potential worst-case scenario variant of COVID-19.
The US, UK, and EU have secured excess Covid-19 vaccines that could meet the requirements of 20 countries affected by conflicts and natural disasters.
Private hospitals in Thailand are not being blocked or delayed from importing COVID-19 vaccines, but they must have the appropriate licenses and vaccine registrations in place first.

The World Bank is collaborating with WHO, UNICEF, Gavi, and ACT-Accelerator, which includes BioNTech Group, to help low- and middle-income countries obtain COVID-19 vaccines through the COVAX program. This is part of a commitment to investing in people and promoting health for all.

The World Health Organization has teamed up with Facebook to combat the spread of false claims about Covid-19 vaccines. The partnership aims to promote reliable information and remove misinformation about vaccines from the internet. The public is urged to check the source, evaluate how it makes them feel, and consider the context before sharing vaccine-related content online.

Two people died in North Bengal districts on March 8 and 9 after receiving the Covishield vaccine. The cause of death was multiple cardiac problems, according to initial assessments. An official provided this information.

People aged 60-64 are now able to book appointments at certain pharmacies in Scarborough for the AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine. The four pharmacies available for booking in Ward 21 Scarborough are located at 2751 Eglinton Ave East, 1235 Mccowan Road, 1411 Warden Ave, and 85 Ellesmere Road.

Zimbabwe's Medicine Control Authority has granted emergency use authorization to four vaccines for COVID-19. Sinopharm and Sinovac vaccines from China, Covaxin from India, and Sputnik V from Russia have been approved for use.

Rich countries have blocked the WTO's TRIPSWaiver proposal again for COVID-19 vaccines, drawing criticism from Oxfam's Anna Marriott who called it a huge missed opportunity. The move would have accelerated the production and scaled up the delivery of life-saving vaccines worldwide. #PeoplesVaccine.

To reduce the burden of COVID-19, vaccines should be allocated fairly and equitably, prioritizing those most at risk. This includes health workers and older adults. #ACTogether for #VaccinEquity. Learn more: https://t.co/4DIRW94Xex https://t.co/uw5TIvbtw7

The development of COVID-19 vaccines is a positive development in the fight against the pandemic. Many vaccines are proving successful and entering development, which is an encouraging sign. Let's #KickCOVIDoutOfKenya.
Louisiana Governor Edwards has expanded COVID-19 vaccine eligibility to people who are 16 and older with certain health conditions. This announcement was made effective immediately.
The CDC has released new guidelines to help clarify what fully vaccinated individuals can and cannot do. The guidelines include recommendations for visiting with other fully vaccinated individuals.

Montana politicians have recently argued that their state is not receiving a sufficient amount of COVID-19 vaccines. Aaron Bolton, a journalist at MTPR, investigated these statements and shared his findings with Corin Cates-Carney, the News Director.

The body is a closed loop system, and the long-term effects of vaccines are unknown. Reports indicate a death rate of about 4% after taking the vaccine in the US and UK, although this may not include unreported deaths.
South African and Chinese police have confiscated a large number of counterfeit COVID-19 vaccines. The announcement was made by Interpol on Thursday.
The OCTAVE study, involving researchers from Leeds Hospitals and UK universities, is examining how people with weakened immune systems respond to the Covid-19 vaccine. #COVID19 #vaccine #research

Tanzanian President Magufuli, a former chemistry professor, has stirred confusion by denying the existence of Covid-19, ridiculing coronavirus tests, opposing mask-wearing and social distancing, and denouncing vaccines as part of a Western plot.
Clinical trials are testing whether it is safe and effective to mix different COVID-19 vaccines.

The COVID-19 vaccine is becoming more widely available in many states. To find out if you are eligible and how to schedule an appointment, you can check the updated resource at https://t.co/lCbTKWcYiE.

Health workers in Kenya have expressed concerns about taking the COVID-19 vaccine, citing fears about potential side effects, lack of knowledge, and the fast pace at which the vaccines were developed as reasons for their hesitancy. This reluctance among healthcare workers could potentially impact the vaccination drive in the country.
The Health Department in Warner Robins is offering Covid-19 vaccines on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays. To schedule an appointment, call 478-749-0179 or 844-987-0099.
LALDEF, together with the Diocese of Trenton, Catholic Charities, and Trenton Health Team, is working to increase access to COVID-19 vaccines, testing and information in Trenton communities.
Mexico's wealthiest city, San Pedro Garza García, is seeing its residents travel to Texas and Florida to receive COVID-19 vaccines.

The Spanish government has denied knowledge of a contract to produce Russia's Sputnik V vaccine domestically, but the Russian Embassy said that talks were underway and biotech firm Zendal has not rejected the claim.
A physician from Iran has been hospitalized due to severe internal bleeding after being inoculated with the Russian Sputnik COVID-19 vaccine. In January, Western vaccines were restricted by Khamenei.

Bishop Joseph C. Bambera has issued a statement regarding COVID-19 vaccines, acknowledging the fear and grief caused by the pandemic and encouraging people to receive the vaccine when it is available to them.
Pakistan has joined the new UN campaign, #onlytogether, which advocates for coronavirus vaccines to be made available to all worldwide to fight the pandemic.

National ad campaigns featuring former US Presidents Obama, Bush, Clinton, and Carter have been launched in an effort to restore public confidence in Covid-19 vaccines that have been undermined due to politicisation over time. #ThisIsOurShot is being used to promote the campaign.

1.5 million COVID-19 vaccines had already been administered in the United States on Joe Biden's inauguration day. Trump was correct during the debate when he predicted a rollout in mid or late 2020, and Biden had no involvement in the prior administration's efforts.

The Hackney African Network is hosting an online vaccine event on 13th March from 2-4pm. Speakers from various African communities will be present, and breakout rooms are available in French, Somali, Swahili, Portuguese, Tigrinya and English. Register at the link provided.

Kenya has received another 100,000 doses of COVID-19 vaccines from India. The vaccination drive is expected to pick up pace, with KDF staff and teachers next in line for inoculation. The country is currently administering doses of the AstraZeneca vaccine, and the latest shipment will help to boost its vaccination efforts.

Starting next Monday, the state of Georgia will expand COVID-19 vaccine eligibility to those aged 55 and over, as well as those with several health conditions. Governor Brian Kemp made the announcement on Wednesday, citing an increase in vaccine supply.

If COVID-19 vaccines do not prevent transmission, then taking the risk of getting vaccinated may not be justified. Those who have discredited hydroxychloroquine and ivermectin have caused American deaths and should face arrest.

Rhode Island Governor Daniel J. McKee has partnered with cities and towns to ensure that all K-12 teachers, school staff, and child care workers receive their first COVID-19 vaccine doses by the end of March.
In the State, 525 new cases of Covid-19 and three more deaths were reported, with 19,228 more vaccine doses administered.

A tweet criticizing the safety of COVID vaccines has received backlash for being uninformed, as all medications have side effects. The concern with COVID vaccines is the unknown long-term effects, as the trials for these vaccines don't end until 2023.

The unequal distribution and access to vaccines across nations is risking the world's ability to contain the pandemic, says @Jayati1609 in a recent article for @TheIndiaForum. The article identifies three major issues currently affecting global vaccination.

The author followed COVID-19 safety guidelines, such as working from home and only socializing with one friend while sitting outside at a distance. However, the author still contracted the virus from their friend. This serves as a reminder to take the virus seriously and continue taking precautions.

This statement is false and not supported by any evidence. The coronavirus, also known as COVID-19, is a real and highly contagious virus that has caused a global pandemic. Governments around the world have implemented stay-at-home orders and other measures to slow the spread of the virus and protect public health. The claim about changing the batteries in birds is nonsensical and has no basis in reality.
Several individuals, including the founder of AltNews and journalist Shekhar Gupta, shared unverified claims about coronavirus that originated from a fake Twitter account.

A 38-year-old man in Patna, who tested positive for COVID-19, has died due to serious kidney problems. He developed renal failure shortly after returning from Qatar. This marks the first virus-linked death in India of someone who is not a senior citizen.

False information circulating in India claims that the country's predominantly vegetarian diet will protect it from the coronavirus. However, there is no link between vegetarianism and the virus. In addition, the belief that India is a country of mostly vegetarians is a myth, with around 80% of Indians consuming meat.

An untrue report circulated online claiming that the Indian government planned to impose a financial emergency to combat the effects of Covid-19. The report is malicious and false, with no such plan in place.
A prisoner who was released early due to COVID-19 concerns has been accused of breaking into a woman's home, tying her up at knifepoint, and threatening to kill her.

A 38-year-old man who had traveled to Qatar has died of COVID-19 and tested positive for the virus at AIIMS in Patna, Bihar.

Qatar has been accused of locking thousands of coronavirus-infected migrant workers in animal shelters without providing them with medical care. The workers reportedly have not been given access to a hospital. This move has been criticized by many, who say that migrant workers have rights and should not be treated as slaves. Some have also criticized human rights organizations for not speaking out against these actions.

Saif Ali returned from Qatar and went to Munger, Bihar. He became unwell and was admitted to the hospital, where he was referred to AIIMS but unfortunately passed away. It was found that he was COVID-19 positive. The police put his entire family in quarantine, but now every member has run away from home, leaving everyone scared.

Japan has closed schools, Italy has closed schools and football games, China has shut down everything, and there is a possibility the Olympics could be cancelled. Despite experts' warnings about COVID-19, President Trump has referred to it as a hoax and urged people to continue working and going to school. The hashtag #TrumpVirus has become popular.

A Twitter user accused President Trump of being a hypocrite for cancelling his trip to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) in Atlanta due to one person allegedly having the coronavirus.

New York's Attorney General, Letitia James, has warned televangelist Jim Bakker to stop selling a fake cure for the coronavirus. Lisa Landau, chief of the AG's Health Care Bureau, sent Bakker a cease and desist letter on Thursday, threatening legal action.

The #FlattenTheCurve graphic is now available on Wikipedia under a CC-BY-SA license. It is encouraged to share the graphic and translate it into as many languages as possible to help spread awareness about flattening the curve during the COVID-19 pandemic. An intelligence report warning of the dangers of a pandemic has been stalled, and the President is not allowing it to be seen. The report is from the Office of the Director of National Intelligence.

Italy has put 60 million people under lockdown due to the rapid increase in COVID-19 cases. Over 9,000 cases have been reported in the country, a significant increase from only 231 cases two weeks ago. All sporting events, schools, universities, theatres, gyms, bars, funerals, and weddings have been closed or suspended, making it an unprecedented response to the coronavirus outbreak.
Georgia is collecting COVID-19 blood samples door-to-door. People are advised to not open the door to strangers unless they have a warrant.

NSUI is pleased with the Maharashtra government's decision to promote final-year students, and thanks them for meeting their demands. They now call on other state governments to do the same in light of the ongoing COVID-19 crisis. The hashtag #PromoteStudentsSaveFuture is being used to promote this movement.
Scientists from the University of Pittsburgh School of Medicine have announced a potential vaccine for COVID-19 caused by the new coronavirus, SARS-CoV-2.
Oxford University has stated that a vaccine for coronavirus could potentially be completed by September of this year.

Anthony Fauci, a leading official at the National Institutes of Health, has stated that the coronavirus vaccine will take between 12 to 18 months to develop. In the meantime, public health measures are necessary to contain the spread of the virus, as a vaccine is not expected in the near future.

Flintstones gummies that were purchased 15 years ago are being promoted as a way to fight against the COVID-19 virus. However, there is no scientific evidence to support this claim, and it is not recommended to rely on expired medication or supplements for treatment.
